intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. insularis, commonly known as the Mediterranean cabbage, is a biennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its compact, round head of tightly packed, dark green leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in temperate climates with well-drained soil. Its leaves are edible and often used in traditional Mediterranean cuisine. This variety is also valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience to pests and diseases.
